cluster_relations.rel_desc: Egyptian pyramids functioned as a gateway to the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject functions in the role or capacity expressed by the object.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egypt: Society, Rulers, and Funerary Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ReligiousFunction: transition point to the afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian tombs are constructed to help ensure the deceased's safe passage into the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an object or structure is intended or used to serve a particular purpose, goal, or desired state.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egypt: Society, Rulers, and Funerary Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Amulets are also meant to aid the deceased's continued existence in the realm of the gods.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an object or structure is intended or used to serve a particular purpose, goal, or desired state.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: eternal existence in the realm of the gods
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: in relation to the realm of the gods

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is designed, intended, or used to achieve the purpose, function, or outcome expressed by the object.
args.justification: All three relations link funerary structures or objects (pyramids, tombs, amulets) to the intended afterlife-related purpose or function they serve (gateway, safe passage, eternal existence). Using a single predicate 'has_purpose' normalizes purpose/functional-role semantics across these instances, and unifying the relation class to 'funerary_purpose_relation' avoids an artificial split between 'funerary_function_relation' and 'funerary_object_purpose_relation' while keeping them in the broad USAGE group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is designed, intended, or used to achieve the purpose, function, or outcome expressed by the object.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations link funerary structures or objects (pyramids, tombs, amulets) to the intended afterlife-related purpose or function they serve (gateway, safe passage, eternal existence). Using a single predicate 'has_purpose' normalizes purpose/functional-role semantics across these instances, and unifying the relation class to 'funerary_purpose_relation' avoids an artificial split between 'funerary_function_relation' and 'funerary_object_purpose_relation' while keeping them in the broad USAGE group.
